channel.title: Loic Rémy on
channel.description: Recent content in Loic Rémy on

item.title: Midterm Report: The luxury loan of Loic Rémy
item.description: In mid January 2013 Newcastle United had a bid in the region of £8m accepted by Marseille for their star forward Loic Rémy. The Frenchman was due to travel to Tyneside to complete the move but in the space of a day he had signed the dotted line in London, for Queens Park Rangers. The ex-Lens man didn’t even bother making the journey to Newcastle and instead opted to sign for the struggling Premier League outfit managed by Harry Redknapp, after a game of FIFA with the club owner Tony Fernandes.
